column4: i should be on the F5 screen after you pop in the install CD..
ok, I'm checking the bios with the latest manual from DFI's website
you do not have to disable ACPI in BIOS.
all you need to do is disable the Ubuntu INSTALLER to use it.
you have to choose an option by typing it in. follow the onscreen help.
i think you find the acpi option on the F7 screen btw
yes. or : expert pci=noacpi (if you are going for an expert install)
don't know how to fix that part man.
ah, so you got more straight-forward irq numbering mostlikely. very good
